docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 29 After three and a half years of political repression and economic austerity, the rightwing military Government, led by President Augusto Pinochet, appears confident that the Chilean economy is slowly recovering and that...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 29 After three and a half years of political repression and economic austerity, the rightwing military Government, led by President Augusto Pinochet, appears confident that the Chilean economy is slowly recovering and that political opposition at home and abroad has been neutralized.

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela The Carter Administration's linkage of human rights to other economic and political issues, repeated last week at a hemispheric conference in Guatemala by Andrew Young, the chief American delegate to the United Nations, has...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela The Carter Administration's linkage of human rights to other economic and political issues, repeated last week at a hemispheric conference in Guatemala by Andrew Young, the chief American delegate to the United Nations, has provoked irritation in many Latin American countries. An important exception, however, is Venezuela, which for its own reasons has endorsed President Carter's concerns.
docs.abstract: Article on Venezuelan Govt's support of Carter Adm's position on human rights; support linked to econ factors; Pres Carlos Andres Perez comments; his por (L)

headline.main: Not Surprisingly, Its Reasons Are Largely Economic; Rights Issue Has Not Upset Venezuela

docs.snippet: LANDOVER, Md., May 15 About half an hour before today's weigh-in, Alfredo Evangelista, husky and with a heavy chin that will tempt Muhammad Ali's patience, moved through the boring types that had gathered in the otherwise empty Capital Centre for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LANDOVER, Md., May 15 About half an hour before today's weigh-in, Alfredo Evangelista, husky and with a heavy chin that will tempt Muhammad Ali's patience, moved through the boring types that had gathered in the otherwise empty Capital Centre for the noon ritual. "That him," somebody said, "that's the fighter." Nearby a lady stared in disbelief. "That's the fighter?" she said.

docs.snippet: LANDOVER, Md., May 16 Alfredo Evangelista, like Rocky, went the distance.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 16 President Carter has stressed what he calls "an undeviating commitment" to human rights everywhere. Yet at the same time, he and Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance have acknowledged that there are limits to how far the United States can go in promoting human rights without producing undesired results.
